alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Candler; Effingham; Evans; Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 2:26PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, EVANS, LIBERTY, BULLOCH, CANDLER, EFFINGHAM, LONG AND TATTNALL COUNTIES... At 226 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cobbtown to near Bloomingdale, and moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Hinesville, Statesboro, Reidsville, Metter, Glennville, Springfield, Claxton, and Pembroke. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Bulloch; Candler; Effingham; Evans; Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall
